meanings.definition: A pipe or tube used to pour concrete underwater.
meanings.sent1: The workers used a tremie to pour concrete into the underwater foundation.
meanings.sent2: The tremie was essential for the construction of the underwater tunnel.
meanings.sent3: The tremie looked like a long straw reaching into the ocean, sipping concrete.
meanings.sent4: The tremie acted as a magical wand, bringing solid ground to the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The tremie, like a giant straw, sucked up concrete and spat out a solid base.

meanings.definition: To pour concrete underwater using a tremie.
meanings.sent1: The construction team will tremie the foundation to ensure it is secure underwater.
meanings.sent2: They tremie the concrete slowly to avoid any air pockets forming.
meanings.sent3: The workers joked that they were 'tremie-ing' a secret message in the ocean floor.
meanings.sent4: She tremied the concrete with precision, like an artist painting underwater.
meanings.sent5: As the diver tremied the concrete, it cascaded gracefully to the seabed below.
